Threat title: An attacker exploits insecure designs or lack of adaption in O-RAN components
Vulnerability:
· Outdated component from the lack of update or patch management 
 · Poorly design architecture 
 · Missing appropriate security hardening
 · Unnecessary or insecure function/protocol/component

Threat title: An attacker exploits misconfigured or poorly configured O-RAN components
Vulnerability:
· Errors from the lack of configuration change management 
 · Misconfigured or poorly configured O-RAN components
 · Improperly configured permissions
 · Unnecessary features are enabled (e.g. unnecessary ports, services, accounts, or privileges)
 · Default accounts and their passwords still enabled and unchanged
 · Security features are disabled or not configured securely

Threat title: Attacks from the internet to penetrate O-RAN network boundary
Vulnerability: Errors in the design and implementation of the network protocols (HTTP, P, TCP, UDP, application protocols)

Threat title: An attacker attempts to jam the airlink signal through IoT devices
Vulnerability: Failure to address overload situations

Threat title: An attacker penetrates and compromises the O-RAN system through the open O-RAN’s Fronthaul, O1, O2, A1, and E2
Vulnerability:
· Improper or missing authentication and authorization processes
 · Improper or missing ciphering and integrity checks of sensitive data exchanged over O-RAN interfaces
 · Improper or missing replay protection of sensitive data exchanged over O-RAN interfaces
 · Improper prevention of key reuse
Affected Components: rApps, xApps, O-RU, O-DU, O-CU, Near-RT RIC, Non-RT RIC

Threat title: An attacker exploits insufficient/improper mechanisms for authentication and authorization to compromise O-RAN components
Vulnerability:
· Unauthenticated access to O-RAN functions 
 · Improper authentication mechanisms 
 · Use of Predefined/ default accounts
 · Weak or missing password policy 
 · Lack of mutual authentication to O-RAN components and interfaces
 · Failure to block consecutive failed login attempts
 · Improper authorization and access control policy

Threat title: An attacker compromises O-RAN monitoring mechanisms and log files integrity and availability
Vulnerability:
· Lack of security event logging
 · Insufficient protection of log files

Threat title: An attacker compromises O-RAN data integrity, confidentiality and traceability
Vulnerability:
· Improper or missing ciphering of sensitive data in storage or in transfer
 · Improper or missing integrity mechanisms to protect sensitive data in storage or in transfer
 · Presence of active function(s) that reveal confidential internal data 
 · No traceability (logging) of access to personal data

Threat title: An attacker compromises O-RAN components integrity and availability
Vulnerability:
· Improper handling of overload situations 
 · Unrestricted boot memory devices 
 · Lack of / improper mechanisms for Network Product software package integrity validation

Threat title: Inconsistent Log Format Impeding Effective Attack Detection
Vulnerability:
· Lack of Centralized Log Management: Without a centralized system to collect and analyse logs, it's difficult to correlate events across different systems, which can obscure the detection of attack patterns.
 · Lack of Log Standardization: Different systems generating logs in various formats can lead to inconsistencies in the data, making it difficult to aggregate and analyse logs effectively.
 · Limited Log Analysis Capabilities: Even with centralized logs, if the analysis tools or processes are not up to the task, potential threats may still go undetected.
 · Inconsistent Time Synchronization: Without synchronized time across systems, it becomes challenging to correlate log entries accurately, which is crucial for tracking attackers' movements and actions.

Threat title: Thrashing O-DU Failovers
Vulnerability: Threat actor spoofs SMO to cause O-DU-1 and O-DU-2 to thrash between Active state and Standby state

Threat title: Dual (Dueling) Active O-DUs
Vulnerability: Threat actor spoofs SMO to cause O-DU-1 and O-DU-2 to both be in Active state.

Threat title: Modify/Inject O1 messages at the SMO
Vulnerability: Threat actor spoofs O-DU to modify, inject, flood O1 messages to the SMO to prevent SMO detection of O-DU failure.

Threat title: Set Incorrect Array-Carrier configuration on O-DU (Standby)
Vulnerability: Threat actor spoofs SMO to set or modify the pre-configured array-carrier configuration on the O-DU in Standby state.

Threat title: Modify Array-Carrier pre-configuration on Shared O-RU
Vulnerability: Threat actor can gain access to Shared O-RU to modify its pre-configured array-carrier

Threat title: Modify/Inject M-Plane messages with Array-Carrier configuration
Vulnerability: Threat actor Modifies/Injects M-Plane messages with Array-Carrier configuration sent to the Shared O-RU.
